properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 5 at 3:16PM PST until January 6 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...MORE MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT FOR THE
CASCADES...NORTHEAST WASHINGTON...BLUE MOUNTAINS...
AND THE IDAHO PANHANDLE...

.One round of snow will occur through tonight for the Cascades and
Idaho Panhandle with moderate accumulations near the Cascade
crest. A stronger storm arrives Monday with snow expanding to
include many areas of Eastern Washington and North Idaho with
moderate to heavy snow accumulations expected.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Valley accumulations 2 to 4 inches except
4 to 6 inches Pend Oreille River Valley and near the Canadian
border. Mountain snow accumulations 6 to 12 inches.

* WHERE...Colville, Northport, Deer Park, Chewelah, Newport,
Kettle Falls, Springdale-Hunters Road, Orin-Rice Road, and
Flowery Trail Road.

* WHEN...From 6 AM to 4 PM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Valley snow is expected to change to rain
late Monday afternoon or Monday night.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 4 PM PST MONDAY
